fullText: This is a show that sneaks up on you with its emotional authenticity and musical intimacy. The staging is so natural, so organic, that you feel like you've stumbled into a Dublin pub where magic just happens to be occurring.
dtliExcerpt: This is a show that sneaks up on you with its emotional authenticity and musical intimacy. The staging is so natural, so organic, that you feel like you've stumbled into a Dublin pub where magic just happens to be occurring.
bwwExcerpt: Whether a broad Broadway public will take to Once is an open question, even if the brilliance of its constituent artistry will surely slay those who most appreciate this form of expression. The music, although beautiful, does not come with the usual tricks. There is neither digital scenery nor spectacle â€” although I swear I saw the streets of Dublin and the possibilities of the world beyond. This is a show that demands that its audience listen. But then, how can you love if you're not willing to allow someone, something, to be heard?
